title: High Gender Equality Rating
description: In 2019, Moldova achieved a CPIA gender equality rating of 4.5, indicating a relatively high level of gender equality in the country.

title: High Female Labor Force Participation
description: As of 2024, females make up 54.72% of the total labor force in Moldova, showing a strong presence of women in the workforce.

title: Low Liner Shipping Connectivity
description: In 2020, Moldova had a liner shipping connectivity index of 0.64, indicating very low connectivity in terms of shipping routes.

title: Low Container Port Traffic
description: In 2019, Moldova's container port traffic was only 818 TEUs, reflecting minimal port activity.

title: High Lead Time to Import
description: In 2016, the median lead time to import goods into Moldova was 32 days, indicating significant delays in import processes.

title: Low Coverage of Unemployment Benefits for Richest Quintile
description: In 2017, only 0.03% of the richest quintile in Moldova received unemployment benefits or active labor market programs, showing very low coverage.

title: High Mortality Rate from Unintentional Poisoning
description: In 2021, Moldova had a mortality rate of 4.15 per 100,000 population due to unintentional poisoning, which is notably high.

title: High Male Mortality Rate from Unintentional Poisoning
description: In 2021, the mortality rate for males due to unintentional poisoning in Moldova was 6.71 per 100,000 male population, indicating a significant health concern.

title: Low Female Employers
description: In 2023, only 0.08% of female employment in Moldova was comprised of employers, indicating a low level of female entrepreneurship.
